Module onethreeseven.stosem
Package onethreeseven.stosem.algorithm

Class MarkovMapMatching

  • java.lang.Object
    • onethreeseven.stosem.algorithm.MarkovMapMatching

  • public class MarkovMapMatching
extends java.lang.Object
    Performs map matching using hidden markov model (HMM) as an underlying probability model. In this HMM observations are GPS recordings and the hidden states of the model are the road edges. This implementation is based on the work: "Hidden Markov Map Matching Through Noise and Sparseness" by Newson and Krumm.

    • Method Detail

      • setOnlyExpandBest

        public void setOnlyExpandBest​(boolean onlyExpandBest)
        Parameters:
        onlyExpandBest - Only expanding the best node is far quicker - but far less accurate.

      • setKeepTopN

        public void setKeepTopN​(int keepTopN)
        If not expanding just the best (setOnlyExpandBest(boolean)), how many paths should we keep for expansion.
        Parameters:
        keepTopN - How many paths to keep in the HMM.

      • setSearchRadius

        public void setSearchRadius​(int radius)
        Changes the search radius when we looking for transitioning segments.
        Parameters:
        radius - How far to look (in meters).

      • setSigma

        public void setSigma​(double sigma)
        In "Hidden Markov Map Matching Through Noise and Sparseness" sigma represents "standard deviation of Gaussian GPS noise". Note: They also provide a method to estimate this per GPS trail.
        Parameters:
        sigma - The standard deviation of GPS entries in this trail (metres).

      • setBeta

        public void setBeta​(double beta)
        In "Hidden Markov Map Matching Through Noise and Sparseness" beta describes the difference between route distances and great circle distances. What they mean by this is median difference between route and great circle distance when considering sequential GPX entries.
        Parameters:
        beta - The median sequential entry difference (metres).

      • setMaxNodesVisited

        public void setMaxNodesVisited​(int maxNodesVisited)
        When searching for potential pathsFrom between edges, any pathsFrom that have to skip more than this number of nodes to be connected are not considered.
        Parameters:
        maxNodesVisited - max number of nodes allowed to skip

      • doWork

        public com.graphhopper.matching.MatchResult doWork​(java.util.List<com.graphhopper.util.GPXEntry> entries)
